title: Thermo Fisher Scientific on Pace for Largest Percent Increase Since April 2017 — Data Talk
text:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (TMO) is currently at $297.06, up $16.07 or 5.72%

-- Would be highest close since Sept. 13, 2019, when it closed at $297.65

-- On pace for largest percent increase since April 26, 2017, when it rose 5.79%

-- Earlier Wednesday, Thermo Fisher Scientific reported a third-quarter profit of $760 million, or $1.88 a share, compared with $709 million, or $1.75 a share, a year ago. The company reported adjusted earnings of $2.94 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $2.00 a share, or $2.87 a share on an adjusted basis

-- The company raised the low end of its revenue guidance for its 2019 fiscal year to between $25.34 billion and $25.50 billion from $25.30 billion to $25.50 billion. The company also increased its adjusted earnings outlook to $12.28 to $12.34 a share, compared with its previous guidance of $12.16 to $12.26 a share

-- Up 1.99% month-to-date; on pace for best month since Aug. 2019, when it rose 3.38%

-- Up 32.74% year-to-date; on pace for best year since 2017, when it rose 34.57%

-- Down 2.74% from its all-time closing high of $305.43 on July 3, 2019

-- Up 34.68% from 52 weeks ago (Oct. 24, 2018), when it closed at $220.56

-- Down 2.74% from its 52 week closing high of $305.43 on July 3, 2019

-- Up 42.5% from its 52 week closing low of $208.47 on Dec. 24, 2018

-- Third best performer in the S&P 500 today

All data as of 11:06:49 AM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 11:29 ET (15:29 GMT)
